alert.note: Alert for Koochiching (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 2:13PM CDT until May 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall combined with already high Rainy Rivers levels. * WHERE...A portion of north central Minnesota, including the following county, Koochiching. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT Monday June 06. Expect increasing river levels through Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The Rainy River level is extremely high. Rises on area tributaries may cause flooding of areas near the mouth of the Black River, Little Fork and Big Fork rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 AM CDT, Doppler Radar and automated rain gauges reported 1 to 2 inches of rainfall over the 24 hour period ending at 11AM Monday. - So far this Spring, the Rainy River at Manitou Rapids has reached a maximum 19 feet. Observed and forecast rainfall could push the river level at Manitou Rapids 2 feet higher than previously observed this year. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...Areas near the mouth of the Little Fork, Big Fork and Black rivers, including Pelland and Loman. - http://www.weather.gov/dlh/RainyRiverBasin
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
